Package model

Class MinesweeperModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.MinesweeperModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class MinesweeperModel
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
This class stores and maintains the game state for a Minesweeper game. It keeps track of the locations of mines, flags, and safe spaces in the minefield as well which parts of the minefield have been "revealed" by the player. It also stores various gameplay data such as the number of mines in the minefield, the dimensions of the minefield, the number of flags that have been placed, whether or not the game is over, and other information.

This class is designed to communicate with MinesweeperController and be observed by a Minesweeper view.
Author:
Katherine Wilson, Giang Huong Pham
See Also:
MinesweeperController, MinesweeperView, Space, Observable, Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • SAVE_NAME

      private static final java.lang.String SAVE_NAME
      Name of the save file that will be created from this game if the game is saved.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • FIELD_WIDTH

      private int FIELD_WIDTH
      Width of mine field.

    • FIELD_LENGTH

      private int FIELD_LENGTH
      Length of the mine field.

    • NUMBER_OF_MINES

      private int NUMBER_OF_MINES
      Number of mines in the mine field.

    • flagsPlaced

      private int flagsPlaced
      Number of flags that have been placed in the field so far by the player. This value should not exceed the number of mines in the field.

    • minefield

      private Space[][] minefield
      Two-dimensional grid of Space objects that represent each possible step in the minefield. The first index represents the y-value of a Space. The second index represents the x-value of Space. Note that rows are from bottom to top (Ex. the first row represents the bottom of the minefield, the second represents the one on top of that one, etc.).

    • mineLocations

      private java.util.HashSet<java.awt.Point> mineLocations
      HashSet that stores the locations of each mine on the minefield using Point objects. Only used during initialization.

    • safeSpacesRevealed

      private int safeSpacesRevealed
      Number of safe Space objects that the player has been revealed by the player so far. This number increases with each safe step the player makes. This will reveal the Space they stepped on as well as any "contiguous zeroes".

    • stepsTaken

      private int stepsTaken
      Number of steps made by the player so far. This is used to determine if a mine should be replaced, should a player step on a mine in their first turn.

    • gameOver

      private boolean gameOver
      true if the game has been won or lost by the player.
      false if the game is still in progress. The player can win by revealing all safe steps in the minefield. The player loses by stepping on a mine.

    • timeInSeconds

      private int timeInSeconds
      time elapsed in seconds since the start of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • MinesweeperModel

      public MinesweeperModel​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Creates a MinesweeperModel object by loading data from the input file.
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the save file which contains data from the previous game.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when there is an error accessing the file.
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if an invalid file is given.
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if a MinesweeperModel cannot be read from the file.

    • MinesweeperModel

      public MinesweeperModel​(int length, int width, int numberOfMines)
      This constructor is called when the user input a specific board size and a valid number of mine
      Parameters:
      length - integer representing how many rows the board has
      width - integer representing how may column the board has
      numberOfMines - integer representing the total number of mine on the board

    • MinesweeperModel

      public MinesweeperModel()
      Creates a MinesweeperModel object and initializes it to a default state by calling helper function to set all fields to the beginning value.

  • Method Details

    • takeStep

      public boolean takeStep​(java.awt.Point location)
      Updates the minefield with the player's new step. This method will update the number of turns made by the player and add their step to appropriate Space in the minefield field. If the player stepped on a mine, the game will end. If the player's step was safe, any "contiguous zeroes" will be revealed. If this is the player's first step and they happen to step on a mine, then that mine will be moved and the minefield will be updated accordingly. This function marks this model as changed and notifies observers of the changes.
      Parameters:
      location - Point object that stores the x and y-coordinates of the player's step.
      Returns:
      true if the step was safe.
      false if the player stepped on a mine.

    • toggleFlag

      public boolean toggleFlag​(java.awt.Point location)
      Adds or removes a flag from the minefield to the Space chosen by the player. If the Space already has a flag, then that flag will be removed. If the Space doesn't have a flag, then a flag will be placed there. This method does not check if the flag's placement is valid. This method will also mark this model as changed and notify any observers of the changes.
      Parameters:
      location - Point object that stores the location chosen by the player to add/remove a flag
      Returns:
      true when a flag is added and false when a flag is removed.

    • getMinefield

      public Space[][] getMinefield()
      Returns the 2-dimensional grid of Space objects used to store data about each location in the minefield.
      Returns:
      2-dimensional grid of Space objects that represent the minefield.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Returns the status of the game. This should be used to determine if the game is in progress or not.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended (the player won or lost)
      false if the game is still going (the player hasn't won or lost yet)

    • getTurns

      public int getTurns()
      Returns the number of steps taken by the player so far.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the number of steps taken by the player so far.

    • getSpacesRevealed

      public int getSpacesRevealed()
      Returns the number of spaces revealed by the player so far. Spaces are revealed by stepping on them or through contiguous means.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the number of safe locations revealed by the player so far.

    • getFlagsPlaced

      public int getFlagsPlaced()
      Returns the number of flags that are currently in the minefield.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the number of flags in the minefield.

    • getNumberofMines

      public int getNumberofMines()
      Returns the number of mines that are in the minefield.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the number of mines in the minefield.

    • getDimensions

      public int[] getDimensions()
      Returns the dimensions of the minefield.
      Returns:
      the dimensions of the minefield as an array of two elements: [length, width].

    • getTime

      public int getTime()
      Returns the current time elapsed in seconds.
      Returns:
      time elapsed in seconds.

    • setTime

      public void setTime​(int time)
      Updates the current time.
      Parameters:
      time - Integer representing number of seconds input

    • saveGameData

      public void saveGameData()
      Creates a save based on the current state of the model. The resulting file will be a .dat file named "saved_game.dat". The file stores this model as an object and can be read by an ObjectInputStream. The state of the game won't be stored if the game has ended.

    • getPlayerWon

      public boolean getPlayerWon()
      Returns whether or not the player has won.
      Returns:
      true if the player has revealed all of the safe Space objects in the minefield.
      false if the player has not revealed them all yet.

    • gameExit

      public void gameExit()
      This method is meant to be called when the user try to close the window.

    • markSpacesAdjacentToMines

      private void markSpacesAdjacentToMines()
      Iterates over each Space object in the minefield and calculates the number of mines that are adjacent to it. A mine is considered "adjacent" if it occurs in any of the 8 spaces surrounding a given space. This function skips over spaces that contain mines. The resulting counts are stored in the respective Space objects.

    • revealContiguousZeroes

      private void revealContiguousZeroes​(java.awt.Point location, java.util.HashSet<java.awt.Point> checkedLocations)
      Recursively marks contiguous zeroes as "revealed" in the minefield grid. Recursion stops when the edge of the minefield is reached, a mine is found, a flag is found, or an already-revealed location was reached.
      Parameters:
      location - location in the minefield that the next spaces to be revealed are derived from.
      checkedLocations - HashSet containing locations that have already been checked so far by this method.

    • initField

      private void initField()
      Initializes a blank minefield with no mines. Space objects with default states are initialized for each location in the minefield.

    • placeMines

      private void placeMines()
      Adds mines randomly to minefield. This is based on the NUMBER_OF_MINES field. If a mine happens to be placed where another mine already is, then that mine will be moved to a new location. The locations of the placed mines will be added to the mineLocations set.

    • replaceMine

      private void replaceMine​(java.awt.Point location)
      Replaces a mine if the player steps on it on their first turn. The mine is removed from the mineLocations set and its location in the minefield grid. If the field happens to be placed in the location of another mine, it will be replaced until it occupies an empty location that is not adjacent to step.
      Parameters:
      location - a Point that contains information of the index to put the mine at

    • defaultSetting

      private void defaultSetting()
      Initializes the MinesweeperModel to a default state. By default, the MinesweeperModel has no revealed safe squares, no turns made, no flags placed, and has not been won or lost yet. This method will also initialize the minefield and place mines within it.
